extension.searchTitle: To allow for judicial review of any final rule addressing carbon dioxide emissions from existing fossil fuel-fired electric utility generating units before requiring compliance with such rule, and to allow States to protect households and businesses from significant adverse effects on electricity ratepayers or reliability.;Ratepayer Protection Act of 2015;H.R. 2042 (RH)

titleInfo.title: To allow for judicial review of any final rule addressing carbon dioxide emissions from existing fossil fuel-fired electric utility generating units before requiring compliance with such rule, and to allow States to protect households and businesses from significant adverse effects on electricity ratepayers or reliability.

extension.officialTitle: To allow for judicial review of any final rule addressing carbon dioxide emissions from existing fossil fuel-fired electric utility generating units before requiring compliance with such rule, and to allow States to protect households and businesses from significant adverse effects on electricity ratepayers or reliability.
extension.action: Mr. Whitfield (for himself, Mr. Griffith, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, and Mr. Peterson) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

Additional sponsors: Ms. Sewell of Alabama, Mr. Latta, Mr. McKinley, Mr. Guthrie, Mr. Sessions, Mrs. Ellmers of North Carolina, Mr. Duncan of Tennessee, Mr. Stivers, Mr. Mullin, Mr. Cramer, Mr. Barr, Mr. Gibbs, Mr. Murphy of Pennsylvania, Mr. Jones, Mr. Brooks of Alabama, Mr. Byrne, Mr. Rogers of Alabama, Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania, Mr. DeSantis, Mr. Bost, Mr. Crawford, Mrs. Hartzler, Mr. Collins of New York, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Forbes, Mr. Jenkins of West Virginia, Mrs. Black, Mr. Long, Mrs. Lummis, Mr. DesJarlais, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. Stewart, Mr. Harper, Mr. Womack, Mr. Roe of Tennessee, Mr. Flores, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, Mr. Kline, Ms. Jenkins of Kansas, Mr. Palazzo, Mr. Hudson, Mr. Babin, Mr. Abraham, Mr. Tipton, Mr. Zinke, Mr. Sensenbrenner, Mr. Bridenstine, Mr. McCaul, Mr. Bilirakis, Mr. Ribble, Mrs. Brooks of Indiana, Mrs. Roby, Mr. Barton, Mr. Shuster, Mr. Jolly, Mr. Ashford, Mr. Luetkemeyer, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mr. Smith of Texas, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Lamborn, Mrs. Love, Mr. Loudermilk, and Ms. McSally
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
